okay now based on all the data, help me fill in my bracket. I'm going to post two teams and you're going to tell me the winner of the game each time. I'm going to paste the team's seed # first, followed by school name.

I understand that you cannot accurately predict who actually wins, that's fine. Just do your best based on the data I've provided.

Ready?
Sure, I'll do my best to help you fill out your bracket! Let's get started.

1 Alabama
 
16 Texas A&M
Alabama would likely be the favorite and the higher seeded team in this matchup, so they would likely be predicted to win against Texas A&M.

5 San Diego St.
 
12 Charleston
Based on the data provided, San Diego State has a higher win percentage than Charleston and is seeded higher, so they would be the favored team to win.

4 Virginia
 
13 Furman
Based on the data you provided, Virginia has a higher win/loss percentage than Furman, so I would predict that Virginia would win this matchup.

6 Creighton
 
11 NC State

Based on the data provided, Creighton has a slightly better overall record and a higher winning percentage than NC State. However, NC State has a better field goal percentage and a higher number of rebounds per game. This could indicate that NC State has a stronger inside game and could potentially out-rebound Creighton. Ultimately, it's difficult to predict with certainty, but I would give a slight edge to Creighton.
im going to go NC state here

Based on the data provided, it is a fairly even matchup between Creighton and NC State. Creighton has a slightly better overall record and better shooting percentages, while NC State has a slightly better defense.

However, as you mentioned earlier, upsets are common in March Madness. If you want to go with NC State as the underdog pick, that is certainly a possibility. It is worth noting that in the last 10 years of the tournament, a 6 seed has been upset by an 11 seed 7 times, so it is not out of the realm of possibility.

3 Baylor
 
14 UCSB

Based on the statistics provided, Baylor has a much better record and more favorable numbers in many key categories. While upsets are always possible, Baylor would be the clear favorite in this matchup. I would pick Baylor to win.

7 Missouri
 
10 Utah St.
Based on the data provided, Missouri appears to be the stronger team with a higher win percentage and better overall statistics. Therefore, I would choose Missouri to win this game.

2 Arizona
 
15 Princeton
Based on the data provided, Arizona is the stronger team and would likely win this matchup against Princeton.

8 Memphis
 
9 Florida Atlantic

Based on the data provided, Memphis and Florida Atlantic have similar overall records, but Memphis has a slightly better win percentage and a higher scoring average. Memphis also has a stronger strength of schedule. Therefore, I would give Memphis the edge and predict them to win this matchup.

5 Duke
 
12 Oral Roberts

Based on the data provided, Duke is the clear favorite in this matchup and is likely to win. However, as we have discussed earlier, upsets are always possible in March Madness, so anything can happen on the court.

4 Tennessee
 
13 Louisiana
Based on the data provided, I would predict Tennessee to win this matchup against Louisiana.

6 Kentucky
 
11 Providence
Based on the data provided, I would go with Kentucky for this matchup.

2 Marquette
